subject: Re: [junit] Re: class cast exception
msgSnippet: ... And it s also important that the Ant task includes a reference to the defined classpath property, and forks a new JVM with that classpath, as in:
messageBody:
yours_jeeva wrote:

> classpath:
> c:\work\commerce;c:\work\commerce\lib\junit.jar;
>
> and C:\WORK\commerce\junit\runner is the location patch file
>
> since my ant script sets the path,
> i added
> <property name="excluded.props" value="${basedir}/commerce" />
> and set the classpath as:
> <property name="classpath"
> value="${weblogic.jar};${excluded.props};${junit.jar}>
>

And it's also important that the Ant task includes a reference to the defined
classpath property, and forks a new JVM with that classpath, as in:

<target name="test" depends="compile.tests" if="junit.present">
<junit fork="yes" printsummary="no" haltonfailure="yes">
<classpath refid="classpath" />
<formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
<test name="com.whatever.MyTest" />
</junit>
</target>
